Description: Granodiorite statue of Sekhmet standing; legs and sun-disc broken off and missing. The figure holds a papyrus-sceptre in the left hand, the top of the sceptre being embellished with incised detail. An ankh-sign is held in the right hand.
Dimensions: Weight: 400 kilograms (Inc stone base and pallet)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2004 21 Mar-31 Oct, Hamm, Gustav Luebcke Museum, War and Peace in Ancient Egypt 2004-2005 10 Dec-17 Apr, Hamburg, Helms Museum, War and Peace in Ancient Egypt 2005 21 May-11 Sept, Mannheim, Reiss Museum, War and Peace in Ancient Egypt 2022 19 May – 25 Sept, London, British Museum, Goddess 2022 - 2023 8 Dec – 27 Aug, Canberra, National Museum of Australia, Goddess
